sample.definition: LOINC Class - arbitrary classification of terms in LOINC designed to assist LOINC development and to group related observations together (e.g. ABXBACT = Antibiotic susceptibility)
LOINC Classtype - 1 = Laboratory class; 2 = Clinical class
LOINC status - valid values are "ACTIVE," "TRIAL," "DISCOURAGED," "DEPRECATED." For "DEPRECATED" concepts, the term that should now be used may appear in the LMP element.
LOINC Change Type Code - type of change made to a LOINC term.
LOINC Date Last Changed YYYYMMDD - date the LOINC term was last changed

sample.definition: Root of a set of LOINC codes - currently used for claims attachments. Yes in this field signifies that this record is the root of a set of LOINC codes
Units required when used as OBX segment - a Y/N field that indicates that units are required when this LOINC is included as an OBX segment in a HIPAA attachment

row.field: ability to respond meaningfully to pressure-related discomfort
ability to change & control body position
Friction - skin rubs against support surfaces. Shear - skin & bony stuctures glide against each other
degree to which skin is exposed to moisture

sample.definition: Classification of whether this LOINC code can be used a full document, a section of a document, or both.

LOINC ORDER_OBS field. Defines term as order only, observation only, or both. Values are: BOTH OBSERVATION ORDER. A fourth category, Subset, is used for terms that are subsets of a panel but do not represent a package that is known to be orderable.
